meanings.definition: Add (something) to the end of a written document or piece of writing.
meanings.sent1: She was appending a new paragraph to her essay.
meanings.sent2: I will be appending my signature at the end of the letter.
meanings.sent3: The detective kept appending clues to his investigation board.
meanings.sent4: His laughter appended a joyful tone to the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist was appending vibrant colors to her canvas, bringing it to life.

meanings.definition: Attach (something) to a document or file.
meanings.sent1: He was appending a photo to the email.
meanings.sent2: Remember to append the receipt to the expense report.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel kept appending acorns to its nest, making it cozy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile appended warmth to the photograph.
meanings.sent5: The student was appending sticky notes to his textbook for quick reference.

meanings.definition: To add or attach something to the end of something else.
meanings.sent1: The secretary was appending the final page to the report.
meanings.sent2: Please append your initials to the last page of the contract.
meanings.sent3: The chef kept appending garnishes to the dishes, making them visually appealing.
meanings.sent4: His words appended a sense of finality to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The tailor was appending intricate details to the dress, enhancing its beauty.
